item.title: Transition continues, part one
item.description: This program goes further in depth about the major changes occuring in jazz during the late 1940s and into the early 1950s.
item.dc:creator: Hentoff, Nat
item.dc:subject: Jazz musicians--United States--Biography.

item.title: West African influence, part one
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, continues to explore the influence of West African music on jazz.
item.dc:creator: Hentoff, Nat
item.dc:subject: Music--Africa--History and criticism

item.title: Chicago jazz, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, continues the discussion of the spread of jazz north from New Orleans into the U.S. midwest.
item.dc:creator: Hentoff, Nat
item.dc:subject: Jazz--Illinois--Chicago.

item.title: Cool jazz continued, part one
item.description: This program focuses on the "cool school" of jazz.

item.dc:subject: Jazz musicians--United States--Biography.

item.title: Bix Beiderbecke, part two
item.description: This program focuses on Bix Beiderbecke, the jazz cornetist, pianist, and composer.

item.dc:subject: Dixieland music

item.title: Early New York jazz, part one
item.description: This program discusses the emergence of jazz in New York, focusing on Fats Waller.

item.dc:subject: Music theory

item.title: Transition into modern jazz, part two
item.description: This program looks at the shift that occurred during the 1940s toward bop, a newer form of jazz.
item.dc:creator: Hentoff, Nat
item.dc:subject: Jazz musicians--United States--Biography.

item.title: Southern African-American influence, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, explores the impact of Southern African-American folk music from the 19th and early 20th century upon jazz music.
item.dc:creator: Hentoff, Nat
item.dc:subject: African Americans--Music--20th century--History and criticism.

item.title: Jazz spreads, part one
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, discusses the various methods that jazz began to spread from New Orleans to other cities.

item.description: This program explores large jazz bands.
